summary: Based on the provided documents, there is no direct mention of Harold S. Sawyer. The documents primarily concern the House Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA) staff payroll records, final determination notifications regarding the release of these records, and background checks on HSCA staff and applicants. The documents focus on the postponement of releasing Social Security numbers to protect personal privacy. The documents also include requests for information from the CIA regarding the criteria for opening a 201 file, and payroll records for Kenneth D. Klein, an HSCA employee.
